body:
Hello, 
  I wanted to post, that via grasshopper i ve managed to rotate back and clean the list . The backwards re-import into Ecotect from Daysim was not reliable and giving odd results . The whole visualisation of the output Im making now in grasshopper ,
  with the help of small script ive assembled.  
  Thought of posting this, since maybe there could be new users, as me, in the community working with the same pipeline ecotect#radiance#daysim experiencing the same concern and not being able to get the final graphic output.  
  best,  Niya  












 -------- Оригинално писмо --------


От: Todor Syarov thodor at abv.bg


Относно: [Radiance-daysim] View Daylighting Analysis Results by DAYSIM 3.1b
	(beta)


До: radiance-daysim at radiance-online.org


Изпратено на: Сряда, 2014, Октомври 1 13:44:12 EEST












   Dear all,












   I am working on a daylight simulation with pipeline:












   IGDB#optics6#window7.2#ecotect2011#radiance#daysim3.1












   Wanted to correct the suggested lines in the Daysim generated *.da file before feeding back into ecotect.














     Is that the way the edited file should look like? 
















    # UDI_100-2000 - Static Shading




    # sensor_file_info 0 0 0 0






    8.937460
       3.357410
       0.850000
       53




    7.818620
       3.555310
       0.850000
       51




    10.334970
       3.110880
       0.850000
       68




    12.336220
       6.915090
       0.850000
       57














   Sadly,the sensor points are rotated from Ecotect into Daysim. How do I rotate them back when I return data to Ecotect or is this process automated?








   Kind Regards, 


   Niya




 var m3_u = (location.protocol=='https:'?'https://a.abv.bg/www/delivery/ajs.php':'http://a.abv.bg/www/delivery/ajs.php');   var m3_r = Math.floor(Math.random()*99999999999);   if (!document.MAX_used) document.MAX_used = ',';   document.write ("  ");
